00047 // EventManager Description
00048 //
00049 // One implementation of the listener registry
00050 //
00051 
00052 typedef std::vector<EventListenerPtr> EventListenerList;
00053 
00054 typedef std::vector<EventType>      EventTypeList;
00055 
00056 class EventManager : public IEventManager
00057 {
00058 public:
00059 
00060         explicit EventManager( char const * const pName,
00061                                                                            bool setAsGlobal );
00062 
00063         virtual ~EventManager();
00064 
00065         // --- primary use functions --- make it work ---
00066         
00067         // Register a listener for a specific event type, implicitly
00068         // the event type will be added to the known event types if
00069         // not already known.
00070         //
00071         // The function will return false on failure for any
00072         // reason. The only really anticipated failure reason is if
00073         // the input event type is bad ( e.g.: known-ident number
00074         // with different signature text, or signature text is empty
00075         // )
00076         
00077         bool addListener ( EventListenerPtr const & inListener,
00078                                            EventType const & inType );
00079 
00080         // Remove a listener/type pairing from the internal tables
00081         //
00082         // Returns false if the pairing was not found.
00083         
00084         bool delListener ( EventListenerPtr const & inListener,
00085                                            EventType const & inType );
00086 
00087         // Fire off event - synchronous - do it NOW kind of thing -
00088         // analogous to Win32 SendMessage() API.
00089         //
00090         // returns true if the event was consumed, false if not. Note
00091         // that it is acceptable for all event listeners to act on an
00092         // event and not consume it, this return signature exists to
00093         // allow complete propogation of that shred of information
00094         // from the internals of this system to outside uesrs.
00095 
00096         bool trigger ( Event const & inEvent ) const;
00097 
00098         // Fire off event - asynchronous - do it WHEN the event
00099         // system tick() method is called, normally at a judicious
00100         // time during game-loop processing.
00101         //
00102         // returns true if the message was added to the processing
00103         // queue, false otherwise.
00104 
00105         bool queueEvent ( EventPtr const & inEvent );
00106 
00107         // Find the next-available instance of the named event type
00108         // and remove it from the processing queue.
00109         //
00110         // This may be done up to the point that it is actively being
00111         // processed ...  e.g.: is safe to happen during event
00112         // processing itself.
00113         //
00114         // if 'allOfType' is input true, then all events of that type
00115         // are cleared from the input queue.
00116         //
00117         // returns true if the event was found and removed, false
00118         // otherwise
00119 
00120         bool abortEvent ( EventType const & inType,
00121                                           bool allOfType );
00122 
00123         // Allow for processing of any queued messages, optionally
00124         // specify a processing time limit so that the event
00125         // processing does not take too long. Note the danger of
00126         // using this artificial limiter is that all messages may not
00127         // in fact get processed.
00128         //
00129         // returns true if all messages ready for processing were
00130         // completed, false otherwise (e.g. timeout )
00131 
00132         bool tick ( unsigned long maxMillis );
00133 
00134         // --- information lookup functions ---
00135         
00136         // Validate an event type, this does NOT add it to the
00137         // internal registry, only verifies that it is legal (
00138         // e.g. either the ident number is not yet assigned, or it is
00139         // assigned to matching signature text, and the signature
00140         // text is not empty ).
00141 
00142         bool validateType( EventType const & inType ) const;
00143 
00144         // Get the list of listeners associated with a specific event
00145         // type
00146 
00147         EventListenerList getListenerList ( EventType const & eventType ) const;
00148 
00149         // Get the list of known event types
00150 
00151         EventTypeList getTypeList ( void ) const;
00152 
00153 private:
00154 
00155         // one global instance
00156         typedef std::set< EventType >                                           EventTypeSet;
00157 
00158         // insert result into event type set
00159         typedef std::pair< EventTypeSet::iterator, bool >               EventTypeSetIRes;
00160 
00161         // one list per event type ( stored in the map )
00162         typedef std::list< EventListenerPtr >                                   EventListenerTable;
00163 
00164         // mapping of event ident to listener list
00165         typedef std::map< unsigned int, EventListenerTable >    EventListenerMap;
00166 
00167         // entry in the event listener map
00168         typedef std::pair< unsigned int, EventListenerTable >   EventListenerMapEnt;
00169 
00170         // insert result into listener map
00171         typedef std::pair< EventListenerMap::iterator, bool >   EventListenerMapIRes;
00172 
00173         // queue of pending- or processing-events
00174         typedef std::list< EventPtr >                                                   EventQueue;
00175 
00176         enum eConstants
00177         {
00178                 kNumQueues = 2
00179         };
00180         
00181         EventTypeSet     m_typeList;           // list of registered
00182                                                                                         // event types
00183 
00184         EventListenerMap m_registry;           // mapping of event types
00185                                                                                         // to listeners
00186 
00187         EventQueue       m_queues[kNumQueues]; // event processing queue,
00188                                                                                         // double buffered to
00189                                                                                         // prevent infinite cycles
00190 
00191         int               m_activeQueue;        // valid denoting which
00192                                                                                         // queue is actively
00193                                                                                         // processing, en-queing
00194                                                                                         // events goes to the
00195                                                                                         // opposing queue
00196 
00197 };
00198 
00199 // Event listener used for snoooping ... simply emits event stats
00200 // for all processed & known events to runtime log ( actually, in
00201 // this case, debugger output )
00202 
00203 class EventSnooper : public IEventListener
00204 {
00205 public:
00206         
00207         explicit EventSnooper( char const * const kpLogFileName = NULL);
00208         virtual ~EventSnooper();
00209         char const * GetName(void) { return "Snoop"; }
00210         bool HandleEvent( Event const & event );
00211 
00212 private:
00213 
00214         FILE *m_OutFile;
00215         char m_msgBuf[4090];
00216 
00217 };
